what is . (dot) for a shell?: Jordan_U: for example what are the differences between: .afile ./afile /afile
.afile is a hidden file in the current directory whose name starts with a dot
./afile is a file in the current directory whose name is simply "afile"
/afile is a file in the root of the filesystem hierarchy. starting with a / makes it an explicit path, rather than a relative one.       ./afile was relative to the current directory
